thread.title: Golf: World No 2 Spieth to compete in Singapore Open - Channel News Asia
thread.title_full: Golf: World No 2 Spieth to compete in Singapore Open - Channel News Asia

title: Golf: World No 2 Spieth to compete in Singapore Open - Channel News Asia
text:
A 
SINGAPORE: World number two golfer Jordan Spieth will be competing in the 50th staging of the SMBC Singapore Open in January next year. 
Organisers on Tuesday (Oct 20) confirmed Spieth's attendance for the tournament, which will make its return after a three-year absence. 
"Playing in the SMBC Singapore Open is something I'm really looking forward to," Spieth said in a statement. "I'm very fortunate to play golf around the world and can't wait to visit Singapore for the first time." 
“I know the SMBC Singapore Open is one of Asia’s leading events and I couldn’t be more excited to add it to my 2016 playing schedule,” Spieth added. 
Spieth enjoyed a breakout 2015, winning two majors at the Masters and US Open. The 22-year-old was also named Player of the Year after becoming the youngest golfer to claim the FedEx Cup and its US$10 million bonus. 
Spieth will be skipping the Farmers Insurance Open on the PGA Tour in favour of the Singapore Open, which features a prize purse of at least US$1 million. 
The 50th Singapore Open will be played at Sentosa Golf Club's Serapong Course from Jan 28 to 31. - CNA/ek
